page.title: 09GLYNDE REACH
page.content: We met the Secretary of the{fishing {club}so he could take us along by the river bank. He said the best part is where we started. As we were walking along we saw some{Jersey heifers.}We saw about fifteen rabbits and then we saw a fish head on the ground which was a roach's head. Later on we saw a swan with two grey cygnets and then we saw a{heron.}We walked to the tenth gate. On the way back we each found a thistle and we heard a{bullfrog } croaking in the rushes. To join the club costs five pounds for grown-ups and three pounds for juniors. There are about 150 members from Glynde and about 15 members from outside Glynde. The kind of fish in there are roach, bream, carp, perch, gudgeon, eel, dace and pike. Beside the river badgers have been seen and sometimes cormorants.
